intro: Calonyction speciosum var. macrantholeucum, commonly known as the white-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
